revised_title: Thermodynamics and Rheological Behavior of Elasto-Viscous Systems under Stress
tldr: The authors studied the thermodynamics and rheological behavior of elasto-viscous systems, such as solutions of rubber in benzene, under stress. They observed that when these systems were subjected to stress, their free energies increased. The research focused on understanding the balance between input energy, energy loss, and energy storage in these systems, which could provide insights into their structure and behavior.
